this round it is a good idea to work away all your ends as it will be awkward to do this once it is attached to the ring depending on your yarn thickness and how much coverage it gives you can work either 1 or 2sc into each stitch i worked 2sc make sure you work over the ring so it is enclosed in the stitch and keep your stitches firm this is a little awkward to do but well worth the effort you can secure the mandala to the ring with stitch markers to make this round easier to work please check the tutorial on attaching the mandala at the front of the pattern round 23 golden yellow ch1 th is fun i have used beads mirrors ribbons and feathers to decorate mine but you could add all kinds of goodies so have fun and let your imagination run wild to make your magic catcher the same as mine 1 crystal drop strings x 3 3 x large crystal drops 6 x plastic crystal discs double hole or a bead will be fine 6 x jewellery crimps you can use a knot if you don t have these 1 5 metres fishing line stretch the line a bit before you start to straighten it out - thread the crimp onto the fishing line thread the fishing line through the hole of the bead and back up through the crimp - squash the crimp flat to secure or use a knot to do the same drop a blob of clear nail polish onto the knot to secure it 27 - thread 2 crystal discs onto each string - if you are using a bead to keep it in place
